Package ohos.event.notification

Class NotificationRequest.NotificationLongTextContent

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.event.notification.NotificationRequest.NotificationLongTextContent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Sequenceable
    Enclosing class:
    NotificationRequest

    public static final class NotificationRequest.NotificationLongTextContent
extends Object
implements Sequenceable
    Constructs notifications that include long text. The long text contains a maximum of 1024 characters.

    This class is used with NotificationContent and NotificationRequest. Example code: 

     NotificationRequest request = new NotificationRequest();
 NotificationLongTextContent longTextContent = new NotificationLongTextContent();
 NotificationContent notificationContent = new NotificationContent(longTextContent);
 request.setContent(notificationContent);
    Since:
    1
    See Also:
    NotificationRequest, NotificationRequest.NotificationContent
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Notification#ANS

      • setAdditionalText

        public NotificationRequest.NotificationLongTextContent setAdditionalText​(String additionalText)
        Sets the additional text to be included in a long text notification.

        The additional text is mainly a supplement to the notification text. Therefore, the font of the additional text is smaller than the notification text and is displayed in a separate line.

        Parameters:
        additionalText - Indicates the additional text to be included.
        Returns:
        Returns the NotificationLongTextContent object with the specified additionalText.
        Since:
        2

      • getBriefText

        public String getBriefText​()
        Obtains the brief text of a long text notification specified by calling the setBriefText(java.lang.String) method.
        Returns:
        Returns the brief text of the long text notification.
        Since:
        2

      • setBriefText

        public NotificationRequest.NotificationLongTextContent setBriefText​(String briefText)
        Sets the brief text to be included in a long text notification.

        The brief text is a summary of a long text notification and is displayed in the first line of the notification. Similar to setAdditionalText(java.lang.String), the font of the brief text is also smaller than the notification text.

        The positions where the brief text and additional text will display may conflict. If both texts are set, only the additional text will be displayed.

        Parameters:
        briefText - Indicates the brief text to be included.
        Returns:
        Returns the NotificationLongTextContent object with the specified briefText.
        Since:
        2

      • getExpandedTitle

        public String getExpandedTitle​()
        Obtains the title that will be displayed for this long text notification when it is expanded.
        Returns:
        Returns the title to be displayed when this notification is expanded.
        Since:
        3

      • setExpandedTitle

        public NotificationRequest.NotificationLongTextContent setExpandedTitle​(String expandedTitle)
        Sets the title to be displayed when this long text notification is expanded. After this title is set, the title set by setTitle(java.lang.String) will be displayed only when this notification is in the collapsed state.
        Parameters:
        expandedTitle - Indicates the title to be displayed when this notification is expanded.
        Returns:
        Returns the NotificationLongTextContent object with the specified expandedTitle.
        Since:
        3

        public boolean marshalling​(Parcel out)
        Marshals a NotificationLongTextContent object into a Parcel.

        A process can call the unmarshalling(ohos.utils.Parcel) method to unmarshal a NotificationLongTextContent object from a Parcel to implement inter-process communication (IPC).

      • toString

        public String toString​()
        Description copied from class: Object
        Returns a string representation of the object. In general, the toString method returns a string that "textually represents" this object. The result should be a concise but informative representation that is easy for a person to read. It is recommended that all subclasses override this method.

        The toString method for class Object returns a string consisting of the name of the class of which the object is an instance, the at-sign character `@', and the unsigned hexadecimal representation of the hash code of the object. In other words, this method returns a string equal to the value of: 

         getClass().getName() + '@' + Integer.toHexString(hashCode())
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        a string representation of the object.
        Since:
        4
